title: Citi Increases Its Contribution to InJAz Bahrain to US$85,000
summary: Manama, Bahrain – The Citi Foundation continues its sponsorship of inJAz Bahrain's "Banks in Action" program, which provides financial education for school students in Bahrain. Citi will invest US$85,000 in the Banks in Action program this year.
tag-1: Citi Increases Its Contribution to InJAz Bahrain to US$85,000
tag-3: Manama, Bahrain – The Citi Foundation continues its sponsorship of inJAz Bahrain's "Banks in Action" program, which provides financial education for school students in Bahrain. Citi will invest US$85,000 in the Banks in Action program this year.
tag-4: Since 2005, the Citigroup Foundation has been annually contributing $40,000 in grants to inJAz Bahrain to implement the "Banks in Action" program at the government secondary schools. The program will reach out to more than 1,560 students of government secondary schools in Bahrain during the academic year 2011-12.
tag-5: Commenting on Citi Foundation's support, Her Highness Shaikha Hessa bint Khalifa Al Khalifa, Executive Director of inJAz Bahrain, said: "I would like to thank Citi again for sponsoring the Banks in Action program for this year. Citibank's employees have become our partners through our various programs. We are pleased with the results of Citi's contributions so far and look forward to more successful achievements of inJAz Bahrain's education-based programs."
tag-6: Conducted by Citibank and other banks' volunteers, the program teaches students about the banking industry and career opportunities in this sector through virtual simulations and competitions.
tag-7: At the end of each school semester, Citibank, a long-time partner of inJAz Bahrain, hosts the "Banks in Action" competition. Teams from the public boys and girls schools participate in the competition, which is based on the "Banks in Action" program. The students assume the roles of managers and, through a special bank-simulation exercise, make decisions on how to best lead.
tag-8: The teams' performance is evaluated through a standard Bank Performance Index (BPI) that is based on net profit, return on assets, return on equity, loan share, deposit share and capital ratio.
tag-9: "As a longtime partner with inJAz Bahrain, we are pleased to contribute to the generation of tomorrow and help them get an insight into the banking sector. Citibank Bahrain is an active corporate citizen, with a particular interest in supporting financial education and developing Bahrain's talent pool," said Mazin Manna, CEO of Citibank Bahrain.
tag-10: Bahrain is the first country in the Middle East to have started implementing the Banks in Action program, having first introduced it in 2006. To date, inJAz Bahrain shared the program with 3,000 students in secondary boys and girls government schools.
tag-11: Citibank employees are actively taking part in several inJAz Bahrain programs, including Job Shadow, More than Money, Business Ethics, Career with a Purpose and Banks in Action. The Banks in Action program has so far reached 58,000 students in 28 countries around the world. It has now been rolled out in several countries in the region, including UAE, Kuwait, Bahrain, Jordan and Lebanon.
